objectives: To identify rose types automatically using the leaves of rose plants.
To develop an expert application for classifying roses using a smartphone camera.
aims: The study aims to optimize the performance of the Random Forest model by tuning its various parameters.
To achieve superior classification results using ensemble classifiers and machine learning models.
scope: The scope covers the machine learning-based identification of rose types by analyzing features from their leaves.

Various machine learning algorithms are tested including Naive Bayes, Generalized Linear Model, Multilayer Perceptron, Decision Tree, Random Forest, Gradient Boosted Trees, and Support Vector Machine.
The study includes the optimization and comparison of ensemble classifiers using different parameter settings.

study_contributions: Designed a methodology for automatic rose classification using rose leaves.
Analyzed the performance of several machine learning models and ensemble classifiers.
Focused optimization efforts on the Random Forest model to improve its classification accuracy.
use_of_technology: The proposed method utilizes smartphone cameras for image capturing of rose leaves.
Implemented machine learning techniques for precise flower identification.
